description: List of threat intelligence producer from security vendors to CERTs including any producer of intelligence at large.
name: Producer

values.description: Intel 471 provides adversary and malware intelligence for leading security teams. Our adversary intelligence is focused on infiltrating access to closed sources where threat actors collaborate, communicate and plan cyber attacks. Our malware intelligence leverages our adversary intelligence and underground capabilities to provide timely data and context on malicious infrastructure.
Sophos Ltd. is a British-based security software and hardware company. It was listed on the London Stock Exchange until it was acquired by Thoma Bravo in February 2020
Group-IB is a creator of cybersecurity technologies to investigate, prevent and fight digital crime
Mandiant is an American cybersecurity firm and a subsidiary of Google.
Thread intelligence provider focusing on data leaks
DomainTools is a leading provider of Whois and other DNS profile data for threat intelligence enrichment.
Feedly is an AI-powered news aggregator application for various web browsers and mobile devices running iOS and Android. It is also available as a cloud-based service.
Database of public networks, IP addresses and domain names owned by companies and organisations worldwide.
Compagny providing comprehensive dataset of internet intelligence
DomainIQ is an internet research tool providing information about a domain name, its owner, the server it's hosted on, its ownership history, similar domains and more.
Computer and Network Security
BitSight is a cybersecurity ratings company that analyzes companies, government agencies, and educational institutions.

RiskIQ, Inc. is a cyber security company that was based in San Francisco, California. It provided cloud-based software as a service (SaaS) for organizations to detect phishing, fraud, malware, and other online security threats. RiskIQ was acquired by Microsoft in July 2021.
Sweepatic is a cybersecurity company
Team Cymru is an internet security firm that offers research services making the internet a more secure place.
G Data CyberDefense AG (until September 2019 G Data Software AG) is a German software company that focuses on computer security.
Sekoia.io is a European cybersecurity SAAS company, whose mission is to develop the best protection capabilities against cyber attacks.

product-type: eXtended Detection and Response SaaS platform

values.description: Excellium Services Group is a cyber-security consulting and technology Integration Company established since 2012 in Luxemburg and Belgium, with activities and in France and Africa.

company-type: Cyber-security consulting and technology Integration Company
product-type: Intrusion Tests – Red Team (Application Security Team)

values.description: Telindus is a brand of Proximus Luxembourg SA. Founded in 1979, Telindus Luxembourg accompanies all organizations in their digital transformation, by providing holistic ICT & Telecommunication solutions, as well as tailored support services. Our areas of expertise include Telecommunication Services, ICT Infrastructure, Multi-Cloud, Digital Trust Solutions, Cybersecurity, Business Applications, Managed Services and Training.

Bleeping Computer is a website covering technology news and offering free computer help via its forums that was created by Lawrence Abrams in 2004. It publishes news focusing heavily on cybersecurity, but also covers other topics including computer software, computer hardware, operating system and general technology.

Cisco Talos, or Cisco Talos Intelligence Group, is a cybersecurity technology and information security company based in Fulton, Maryland. It is a part of Cisco Systems Inc. Talos' threat intelligence powers Cisco Secure products and services, including malware detection and prevention systems. Talos provides Cisco customers and internet users with customizable defensive technologies and techniques through several of their own open-source products, including the Snort intrusion prevention system and ClamAV[3] anti-virus engine

Headquartered in The Hague, the Netherlands, Europol’s mission is to support its Member States in preventing and combating all forms of serious international and organised crime, cybercrime and terrorism. Europol also works with many non-EU partner states and international organisations.

ESET, s.r.o., is a software company specializing in cybersecurity. ESET's security products are made in Europe and provide security software in over 200 countries and territories worldwide. Its software is localized into more than 30 languages. The company was founded in 1992 in Bratislava, Slovakia.

Tencent is a world-leading internet and technology company that develops innovative products and services to improve the quality of life of people around the world. Founded in 1998 with its headquarters in Shenzhen, China, Tencent's guiding principle is to use technology for good. Our communication and social services connect more than one billion people around the world, helping them to keep in touch with friends and family, access transportation, pay for daily necessities, and even be entertained. Tencent also publishes some of the world's most popular video games and other high-quality digital content, enriching interactive entertainment experiences for people around the globe. Tencent also offers a range of services such as cloud computing, advertising, FinTech, and other enterprise services to support our clients' digital transformation and business growth. Tencent has been listed on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong since 2004.

Kaspersky Lab (/kæˈspɜːrski/; Russian: Лаборатория Касперского, romanized: Laboratoriya Kasperskogo) is a Russian multinational cybersecurity and anti-virus provider headquartered in Moscow, Russia, and operated by a holding company in the United Kingdom. It was founded in 1997 by Eugene Kaspersky, Natalya Kaspersky and Alexey De-Monderik. Kaspersky Lab develops and sells antivirus, internet security, password management, endpoint security, and other cybersecurity products and services.

Palo Alto Networks, Inc. is an American multinational cybersecurity company with headquarters in Santa Clara, California. The core product is a platform that includes advanced firewalls and cloud-based offerings that extend those firewalls to cover other aspects of security. The company serves over 70,000 organizations in over 150 countries, including 85 of the Fortune 100. It is home to the Unit 42 threat research team and hosts the Ignite cybersecurity conference.

Trend Micro Inc. (トレンドマイクロ株式会社, Torendo Maikuro Kabushiki-Gaisha) is an American-Japanese cyber security software company. The company has globally dispersed R&D in 16 locations across every continent excluding Antarctica. The company develops enterprise security software for servers, containers, & cloud computing environments, networks, and end points.

synonyms: トレンドマイクロ株式会社

values.description: AhnLab, Inc. offers industry-leading cyber security solutions and services for consumers, enterprises, and small and medium-sized businesses worldwide.  Founded in 1995, AhnLab provides comprehensive protection for endpoint, cloud, network, and other services. With its headquarters in South Korea, the most wired country in the world, AhnLab has become a leading innovator of dynamic security solutions that counter cyber threats.

Check Point Software Technologies Ltd. is an American-Israeli multinational provider of software and combined hardware and software products for IT security, including network security, endpoint security, cloud security, mobile security, data security and security management.

The Computer Emergency Response Team of Ukraine (CERT-UA) is a specialized structural unit of the State Center for Cyber Defense of the State Service for Special Communications and Information Protection of Ukraine.

Avast Software s.r.o. is a Czech multinational cybersecurity software company headquartered in Prague, Czech Republic, that researches and develops computer security software, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.

The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is a component of the United States Department of Homeland Security (DHS) responsible for cybersecurity and infrastructure protection across all levels of government, coordinating cybersecurity programs with U.S. states, and improving the government's cybersecurity protections against private and nation-state hackers.

JPCERT/CC is the first CSIRT (Computer Security Incident Response Team) established in Japan. The organization coordinates with network service providers, security vendors, government agencies, as well as the industry associations. As such, it acts as a 'CSIRT of CSIRTs' in the Japanese community. In the Asia Pacific region, JPCERT/CC helped form APCERT (Asia Pacific Computer Emergency Response Team) and provides a secretariat function for APCERT. Globally, as a member of the Forum of Incident Response and Security Teams (FIRST), JPCERT/CC cooperates with the trusted CSIRTs worldwide.

Proofpoint, Inc. is an American enterprise cybersecurity company based in Sunnyvale, California that provides software as a service and products for email security, identity threat defense, data loss prevention, electronic discovery, and email archiving.

Qihoo 360 (Chinese: 奇虎 360; pinyin: Qíhǔ Sānliùlíng; approximate pronunciation CHEE-hoo), full name 360 Security Technology Inc., is a Chinese internet security company that has developed the antivirus software programs 360 Safeguard and 360 Mobile Safe, the Web browser 360 Secure Browser, and the mobile application store 360 Mobile Assistant.
Bitdefender provides cybersecurity solutions with leading security efficacy, performance and ease of use to small and medium businesses, mid-market enterprises and consumers.

Avira Operations GmbH & Co. KG is a German multinational computer security software company mainly known for its Avira Free Security antivirus software. Since 2021, Avira has been owned by American software company NortonLifeLock (now Gen Digital), which also operates Norton, Avast and AVG. It was previously owned by investment firm Investcorp.

Cloudflare, Inc. is an American company that provides content delivery network services, cloud cybersecurity, DDoS mitigation, wide area network services, reverse proxies, Domain Name Service, and ICANN-accredited domain registration services. Cloudflare's headquarters are in San Francisco, California.
Recorded Future, Inc. is an American privately held cybersecurity company founded in 2009, with headquarters in Somerville, Massachusetts.
Cyble empowers organizations to take control of their cyber risks with AI-driven, cybersecurity platforms.
CYFIRMA is a threat discovery and cyber-intelligence company with the world’s first platform that can deliver predictive cyber-intelligence
SentinelOne, Inc. is an American cybersecurity company listed on NYSE based in Mountain View, California.

Fortinet, Inc. is a cybersecurity company with headquarters in Sunnyvale, California. The company develops and sells security solutions like firewalls, endpoint security and intrusion detection systems.
Zscaler, Inc. (/ˈziːˌskeɪlər/) is an American cloud security company based in San Jose, California. The company offers cloud-based services to protect enterprise networks and data.
Splunk Inc. is an American software company based in San Francisco, California, that produces software for searching, monitoring, and analyzing machine-generated data via a web-style interface.

Huntress Labs Incorporated operates as a security software solution provider. The Company provides managed threat detection and response services to uncover, address persistent footholds that prevent defenses. Huntress Labs serves customers in the United States.
A brand of enterprise security software purchased by Broadcom Inc. in August 2019
Microsoft Corporation is an American multinational corporation and technology company headquartered in Redmond, Washington.
Part of the SANS Technology Institute, the Internet Storm Center (ISC) stands as a beacon of vigilance and resilience in the ever-evolving landscape of cybersecurity.
CloudSEK is a contextual AI company that predicts Cyber Threats. Combining the power of Cyber,Brand & Attack Surface monitoring to give context to Digital Risk.
Netskope, a global SASE leader, helps organizations apply zero trust principles and AI/ML innovations to protect data and defend against cyber threats.
Real Intrusions by Real Attackers, The Truth Behind the Intrusion
American cybersecurity technology company founded in 2012.
Silent Push was founded to transform the way organizations across the world track, monitor and counteract global threat activity.
Any.run provides a sandbox environment where users can monitor, analyze, and detect cybersecurity threats.

Aqua Security is the pioneer in securing containerized cloud native applications from development to production. Aqua's full lifecycle solution prevents attacks by enforcing pre-deployment hygiene and mitigates attacks in real time in production, reducing mean time to repair and overall business risk
Qualys, Inc. is an American technology firm based in Foster City, California, specializing in cloud security, compliance and related services.
Zimperium, Inc. is a privately owned mobile security company based in the United States and headquartered in Dallas, Texas.
Intezer's Genetic Malware Analysis technology enables security teams to automate memory and file analysis

Forcepoint is an American multinational corporation software company headquartered in Austin, Texas, that develops computer security software and data protection, cloud access security broker, firewall and cross-domain solutions.
Elastic NV is an American-Dutch software company that provides self-managed and software as a service (SaaS) offerings for search, logging, security, observability, and analytics use cases.
Infoblox, is a privately held IT automation and security company based in California's Silicon Valley.

company-type: Computer networking and Cyber Security Vendor

values.description: Akamai Technologies, Inc. is an American delivery company that provides content delivery network(CDN), cybersecurity, DDoS mitigation, and cloud services.

Sucuri is a content distribution network service (CDN) provider that helps websites to load faster while increasing their resilience to intrusions from malware, DDoS attacks, and hacker activity. Users can easily monitor the performance and safety of their websites using the Sucuri WordPress plugin and the company offers multiple caching options to suit numerous different types of websites.
Volexity is a Washington, D.C.-based cyber security firm with a global reach.

Rapid7 Inc (Rapid7) offers data security and analytics solutions. It offers products such as insightVM, nexpose, metasploit, appspider, insightAppSec, insightIDR and insightOps. The company offers services including advisory services, penetration testing services, IoT security testing services, vulnerability management services, incident detection, and response services. Rapid7 also provides various solutions including vulnerability management, penetration testing solutions, web application security testing, IT operations, user behavior analytics (UBA), Siem, consulting services, and managed security services.
Outpost24 empowers organizations to achieve cyber resilience with a complete range of continuous threat exposure management (CTEM) solutions.
IT security blog focusing on malware forensics, dynamic and static analysis, as well as automated malware analysis techniques.
Morphisec provides a proactive security solution for workstations, virtual desktops, and server workloads to prevent cyberattacks.
HarfangLab, as part of its business as a supplier EDR (Endpoint Detection and Response)

Hunt.io is a service that provides threat intelligence data about observed network scanning and cyberattacks. This data is collected by a worldwide distributed network of sensors. All interactions with sensors are registered, analyzed, and used to create network host profiles.

ASEC is a full-service cybersecurity firm helping organizations build and maintain trust with our offensive security assessments, consulting, and training. Since 2015, the firm has provided security services to numerous organizations across North America, particularly within the government, finance, healthcare, education, technology, media, retail, energy and manufacturing sectors.

Cyware is a cybersecurity company specializing in threat intelligence and security orchestration. It provides solutions for organizations to strengthen their security posture through the automation and collaboration of threat management processes.
BlueTeamSec is an online community and forum designed for professionals, students, and hobbyists involved in defensive cybersecurity practices.

SonicWall is a cybersecurity company that provides network security, access security, and endpoint security solutions. The company specializes in firewalls, secure remote access, and threat intelligence.

VirusTotal is an online service that analyzes files and URLs for viruses, worms, trojans, and other kinds of malicious content. It aggregates multiple antivirus products and scan engines to provide a comprehensive threat detection solution.
CrowdStrike is a leading cybersecurity company providing cloud-native endpoint protection and threat intelligence. It specializes in preventing, detecting, and responding to cyber threats.

Rewterz is a cybersecurity solutions and services provider specializing in threat intelligence, security monitoring, and incident response. It offers tailored solutions to help organizations secure their digital environments.

Malwarebytes is a cybersecurity company known for its malware detection and remediation solutions. It offers software to protect businesses and consumers from malware, ransomware, and other online threats.
GBHackers is a cybersecurity news and information portal. It provides the latest updates on cyber threats, vulnerabilities, and security tips, catering to both professionals and enthusiasts.

Securonix is a leading cybersecurity company that provides next-generation security information and event management (SIEM) solutions. It focuses on user and entity behavior analytics (UEBA) and threat detection.
Cybersecurity News is an online platform providing the latest updates, insights, and news on cybersecurity trends, threats, and best practices.
The Google Cloud Blog provides insights, updates, and guidance on cloud computing and cybersecurity solutions, including Google’s offerings in infrastructure security and threat detection.

PwC is a global professional services firm offering consulting, audit, and cybersecurity services. It helps organizations enhance their security posture through strategic advisory and implementation services.
Juniper Networks Blogs provide insights and updates on networking, cybersecurity, and IT infrastructure. The platform covers threat prevention, detection, and emerging technologies in networking.

Security Affairs is a leading cybersecurity blog and news site, providing detailed insights into cyber threats, vulnerabilities, and incident reports. It caters to professionals and enthusiasts alike.
SecurityWeek is a cybersecurity news and analysis platform that provides in-depth coverage of cybersecurity trends, threats, and emerging technologies.

Trellix is a cybersecurity company offering advanced threat intelligence, extended detection, and response (XDR) solutions. It focuses on proactive security measures to protect organizations against evolving cyber threats.

The BlackBerry Blog shares insights and updates on cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, and secure communications. It focuses on providing resources for both professionals and enthusiasts in the field of secure technology.
The Broadcom Blog provides updates and insights on its products and services, with a focus on cybersecurity, networking, and software solutions tailored to enterprise needs.
McAfee Labs provides cybersecurity threat intelligence and research on emerging threats, malware, and security trends. It offers valuable insights to help protect both consumers and businesses.
LinkedIn is a professional networking platform that also serves as a hub for cybersecurity professionals to connect, share insights, and stay updated on industry trends.

Medium is an online publishing platform where cybersecurity professionals, enthusiasts, and writers share articles, tutorials, and insights about emerging trends and challenges in the cybersecurity domain.

Perception Point is a cybersecurity company specializing in advanced threat prevention for email, web browsers, and collaboration platforms. It provides cloud-native solutions to detect and block malware, phishing, and zero-day attacks.

ReliaQuest is a cybersecurity company that provides a cloud-native Open XDR platform for threat detection, investigation, and response. It helps organizations achieve visibility and control across their security ecosystems.

EclecticIQ is a cybersecurity company offering threat intelligence, hunting, and response solutions. Its platform integrates data from multiple sources to help organizations enhance their security posture.

Arctic Wolf is a cybersecurity company that provides managed detection and response (MDR) services, security operations solutions, and continuous threat monitoring to help organizations detect and neutralize cyber threats.

products: Security Operations Center as a Service

values.description: Nextron Systems is a cybersecurity company that develops advanced threat detection and response solutions. It provides tools for malware analysis, incident response, and threat hunting.
NetSec is a UK-based cybersecurity information platform providing news, resources, and tools for security professionals. It covers the latest updates on cyber threats and defense strategies.

Sygnia is a cybersecurity consulting and incident response company that provides advanced solutions for cyber resilience. It helps organizations respond to incidents and improve their security posture.

Datadog is a monitoring and security platform for cloud-scale applications. It provides full visibility into cloud environments with tools for application performance monitoring, log management, and security monitoring.
Embee Research is a cybersecurity platform focusing on threat research and intelligence. It offers detailed reports and insights into malware trends, vulnerabilities, and security challenges.
eSentire is a managed detection and response (MDR) service provider. It specializes in protecting organizations from advanced cyber threats with 24/7 threat monitoring and response services.
The Kandji Blog shares updates, insights, and best practices for device management and security, with a primary focus on managing and securing Apple devices in enterprise environments.

Dragos is a cybersecurity company specializing in securing industrial control systems (ICS) and operational technology (OT) environments. It provides solutions for threat detection, asset visibility, and incident response.

PolySwarm provides a decentralized marketplace for threat detection, connecting cybersecurity experts and enterprises to improve malware detection. The platform incentivizes security researchers to create and share threat intelligence.
TeleSec is a cybersecurity service provider under Deutsche Telekom, offering cloud security, managed services, and solutions to secure enterprise IT infrastructures.
The Wiz Blog provides insights, updates, and best practices on securing cloud-native environments. Wiz specializes in cloud security, risk management, and vulnerability detection.
IBM X-Force is a cybersecurity research and intelligence platform providing insights, tools, and services to help organizations detect, understand, and respond to cyber threats.
TG Soft is an Italian cybersecurity company providing antivirus and endpoint protection solutions. It also conducts malware research and offers tools for malware detection and removal.

Seqrite is a cybersecurity company that offers endpoint protection, network security, and other enterprise-level security solutions. It helps businesses protect their digital assets from evolving cyber threats.
Cado Security provides cloud forensics and incident response solutions, helping businesses detect, investigate, and mitigate threats in their cloud environments.

Security Boulevard is a leading cybersecurity blog that aggregates news, analysis, and insights about the security industry. It features articles from security experts on a variety of cybersecurity topics.
Lab52 offers a wide range of cybersecurity services, including threat hunting and incident response. Their blog provides insights into security research, threat analysis, and mitigation strategies.

GreyNoise is a cybersecurity company that provides internet-wide threat intelligence by collecting and analyzing data from internet-connected devices. It helps security teams by filtering out noise from malicious activity and identifying the true threats targeting an organization.

AbuseIPDB is a project dedicated to providing a centralized database for reporting and checking IP addresses involved in malicious activities. It helps organizations identify harmful IPs associated with spamming, hacking, fraud, and other cybercrimes.

RansomLook provides a comprehensive set of tools for identifying and analyzing ransomware-related incidents. It focuses on detecting ransomware payloads, providing intelligence on ransomware families, and offering insights into how ransomware attacks operate.

URLScan.io is a free service that analyzes websites by submitting their URLs and providing a detailed report of their behavior and security status. It helps cybersecurity professionals identify malicious websites and investigate potential threats from suspicious URLs.
Farghlymal's GitHub blog is a platform where security-related content is shared, including tutorials, code samples, and research on various cybersecurity topics.
